meanings.definition: Preprinted with a postage stamp or indicia.
meanings.sent1: The prefranked envelope already had a stamp on it.
meanings.sent2: The prefranked letter was ready to be sent out.
meanings.sent3: The prefranked package was like a gift waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent4: Her prefranked invitation stood out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The prefranked postcard caught my eye with its colorful stamp.

meanings.definition: To have affixed a postage stamp or indicia before mailing.
meanings.sent1: She prefranked the envelopes for the party invitations.
meanings.sent2: He always prefranked his letters to save time at the post office.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat prefranked the bills with paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The idea prefranked in her mind before she even wrote it down.
meanings.sent5: The memories were prefranked on the postcards she sent from her travels.

meanings.definition: A piece of mail that has already been stamped or marked with postage.
meanings.sent1: She dropped the prefranked into the mailbox on her way to work.
meanings.sent2: The prefranked arrived at his doorstep without any additional postage needed.
meanings.sent3: The prefranked was a pleasant surprise in the midst of bills.
meanings.sent4: The prefranked stood out in the pile of unmarked envelopes.
meanings.sent5: The prefranked postcard brought a smile to her face as she read it.
